review: In a rush and wish to eat in? This is not the place. One must have more than an hour to enjoy a sit down and calmly wait for drinks and food. Additionally, the cost will be higher than regular CPK's outside the airport. Pricier leases, multiple shifts to cover lag times, and security clearances all add to the surcharge of up to approximately 18% more.  With that mouthful all said and done, let's get down to the nitty-gritty of this CPK.  It is always hectic here. Located in the Terminal 1 Southwest ( under construction of course) (( is there any place at LAX not under construction? )) plenty of planes are always on take-off or landing with people hustling and bustling thru. Getting a table may take some doing at peak hours. The good thing is people are in a hurry to eat and leave. Our wait time was 15-20 minutes for a table. My publicist/agent/manager said, ok. Plus, he said I could pay from his next commission. (Last one was 9 years ago) Considering we had 2 hours to kill, it was of no consequence. Noticed the Menu is not as extensive as a regular CPK but some old favorites were there,,,,like Stella Draft Beer. 2 beers, a Margherita pizza,and a Cobb salad later, we were pleasantly happy (happier).  Unable to go wrong with what we ordered, tasted just like it should, was out pretty quick, and so we made our dash in under 2 hours. Altogether uneventful, but sometimes, thats a blessing.

Over priced for their regular menu, $19 for a pizza. We were willing to just pay it since one pizza would be enough for two people to split (you would think) but when the pizza came out it was barely bigger than my hand. What the heck.  How does it cost more than the regular cpk and come out half the size?!!!! Also, why are there so many people working?! We counted 16 people not including who's working in the kitchen. This place is so small and it was already congested and workers are squeezing their way around and just hanging out texting. We were told to go sit at the bar by the hostess  and when we went over there there were 3 workers bored just sitting in the seats. It wasn't until the bartender saw we were confused of where to go until he told them to move. Don't come here unless you love throwing away your money for small portion sizes.

Early in the morning you get excited to see there is more than breakfast places that are open. So as I walked with joy to the open CPK, I followed directions to "please wait to be seated" as I stand there longer than 5 min, with open tables in front of me..... I wonder why no one is helping me. There was a bartender staring at me, maybe since we caught each others eye, he would warn someone. And yet I stand there waiting..... Once my partner decided to ask what to do, they sit us down facing the entrance that I had been standing at for 7min....  I ordered quickly, and food was revived in a timely manor, and consistent with CPK.... but I can't shake the feeling the staff is lazy under the hand of Todd the manager... I know his name because when I asked the waitress and runner why three patrons walked away because no one helped them. She said her manager was right here... I looked in the direction and he is keke'ing with the bar.... Honestly, I'm disturbed. And disappointed in their work ethic

Waiting for our flight and didn't want to walk too far so we grabbed whatever that was the closest to us  There's one line for a quick grab and go pizza/salads etc.. and there's another line to dine in. Got confused when we first got there.Got seated right away and the service wasn't bad, I remembered it being fairly slow but not horrible.  I had my standards at "airport food" level but it tasted pretty good. Ordered the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza and I never realized how bomb their spinach-artichoke dip is!!! MUST. HAVE.  The one thing I did notice was their chairs.. they look so disgusting and so dirty. Pls change those out

We couldn't use our priority pass in terminal one so we had to pay for food. Not a lot of food options In terminal one, gate 16. We decided to go to CPK. I can see why this place only got 2 stars on Yelp. Why do restaurants at airports have such a bad wrap? How come the service and the food can't be the same like the real restaurants? Anyways, I ordered the pea soup and asked if it comes with crackers or bread. The server said no but she'd get me cracker anyways. So, the soup comes and guess what? No crackers. At least the soup was warm and decent. Boyfriend ordered a cheese pizza which took 30 mins. He says it taste just like the CPK frozen pizza you get at the grocery store.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017 - PART 3: 86/100 I never mind being at the airport a couple of hours early. This gives me the chance to just hangout a bit before getting on a plane.  Not a fan of Rock and Brews (aka I hate that plac - see reviews if curious enough) and I've tried Reilly's (it was okay) so next in line was CPK.  I told the host I didn't need to be seated at a table and that I was more interested in sitting at the bar. She welcomed me in and confirmed open seating in that area.  Can't go wrong with beer (it was the weekend, after all) and something else to munch on. I saw all of their listed apps come out of the kitchen and they all looked really good. But, eh, I wanted to keep it simple, so I went for the guac+chips, which, by the way, looked mighty interesting - it had a lot of fillers per its description.  Now, I'm not really a fan of corn or cilantro, and yes, I am aware that both were included. I didn't really want to knock it until I tried it. Bowl got delivered and first thing I noticed was the whole thing was bombarded with corn. There was nothing "guac" about its appearance, for real.  But! I did ask for it, so I had to have at least a taste.  It was surprisingly very guacamole-y! The flavor of the avocado overpowered everything else on that bowl - including the taste of corn and cilantro. The crisp of the apple was a nice touch. I'll admit - I liked it.  And it was a lot, so I didn't finish it.  Service was mediocre. Nothing to be too excited about.  Average at best. I'd probably stop by again.

Aside from the hiked up prices, which is expected because it's the airport, the service here was HORRIBLE. We waited a few min in line to place a quick to-go order at the register.  We ordered two soups and a pizza. They have the pizzas ready to go in a heated area, so we got that right away but the soups, which we thought would have taken two seconds took 15 - 20 MINUTES TO GET. Our cashier said she would be right back with our soups, she then came back to tell us that she had to call a manager because the soup was too hot for her to pour.  5 min later ... no manager. She spots him walking around and starts to scream his name loudly over and over. He sees her and then walks around to the back. We thought he was going to get us our soup, but we never saw him again. She then tells us she had to call another manager and then begins to badmouth them all calling them stupid and how it takes 3 people to do a simple task here. I can't stand when employees bad mouth other coworkers to customers. It just irks me, and shows what kind of person you are. You all work there, you're all in it together, you all represent the company so help fix it.  While were standing off to the side, she proceeds to ring up other people, which she has to do to keep the line flowing, but then it became very easy for her to forget we were waiting. Another 5 min later, I see a different manager in the kitchen now screaming her name and she shouts back at him to pour the soups!! It took this dude another 5 min to do that and then walks them over to the register and places them by her on the counter. They were unreachable to us, and she was helping another customer so we had to wait for her to be done with that person. She then leaves to get that persons order and leaves our soup there. Why didn't the manager say "Who was waiting for soup?" And hand them to us? No he was just as careless and incompetent. At this point I was livid. My friend squeezes through the line and reaches over the counter to grab our soups which were poured in coffee cups and lids. Not very appealing. The soups were not even three quarters of the way full. No one noticed we reached for them and took them on our own. RIDICULOUS. This is an airport, people are on a time crunch. Get it together CPK. Never again.

I had one hour between my connecting flight and was craving something fresh yet filling-- so I decided to sit-in @ this CPK and ordered their buffalo chicken pizza. It was a decent portion and quite delicious, although under seasoned. I had to add salt and pepper and even then I think it could have had some more spices, or even just cheese! Service was fine and it was exactly how I expected it to be. Other Yelpers have complained about the price but that's to be expected with any and all airport food, isn't it? My meal costed $23 total for salad + avocado & 20% tip.

Such an unpleasant experience that we left while waiting for our food. Eye rolls when asked to be seated near a television. Eye rolls when ordered water. Eye rolls when asked for another moment to look at the menu.  And then a 15+ minute wait for a turkey sandwich. To be honest we don't know how much longer it would have taken because we had to leave to queue for our flight. Airport food services are usually known for expeditious service due to guests having to come and go. This CPK couldn't be arsed in the least. They were not remotely crowded.

I had a really good omelette here while waiting for my flight. I ordered the Sonoma omelette which was made with egg whites, Parmesan, basil and zucchini, topped with mashed avocado and came with a side of roasted potatoes and toast (which I didn't eat). My only complaint is they didn't have Tabasco sauce which I always put on my eggs. I know it's just an airport restaurant but I actually had a really good experience here and would recommend for breakfast.

Let me start by saying this is one of the most unpleasant airport dining visits I have ever had.  I was highly disappointed with the lack of customer service.  Establishment: clean located right in the middle of the southwest terminals. Very central location.  Service: the service was beyond a negative rating the 1 star here was for pizza. ( I would give the cooks a raise)  Our service was very rude. I asked for a coke she gave me diet and when I asked for a regular she didn't apologize she got sassy and said oh is this a diet? As if I was lying. 15 minutes we got our pizza... she didn't bother to bring us plates for the first ten minutes so we had to use our napkins and then we had to ask another server for plates because our server was to busy to bring them to us. ( see pictures)  If you are having a bad day or just have a bad attitude please stay away from the customer service and food industry. It would have been nice to be greeted by a friendly face and not have to eat like animals at our table without plates/utensils and napkins.

Stopped for a quick bite while we waited for our flight - I wanted something quick so I went with their caprese wrap, which was pretty much flavorless if you did not add the sauce.  My boyfriend and his family ordered their CPK classic breakfast sandwich, the lady didn't tell us that they were out of their chicken sausage pattys so the sandwich literally just had bacon, egg and cheese. Figured it'd be a little cheaper but it was the same cost at $13-14.  Best part about this place was one of the bartenders - we didn't catch his name but he made our (short) stay at the restaurant fairly enjoyable. Aside from that, I would not order breakfast here again.

If you're trying to grab a quick meal between flights, this is not your stop. They were jam packed, and we waited about 20 minutes for a table, which we ended up having to share with another guest.  There aren't enough servers, so things didn't speed up much once seated.  We ordered pizza and drinks quickly, but they took about 25 minutes to come out. The food was good, that's why I'm giving 3 stars, but otherwise I wouldn't have recommended this CPK.  Keep in mind prices are quite high as well, up to $20 for a small single pizza.  Seeing as they were jam packed, I don't expect prices will change or service will speed up.

Lax terminal 1 or Southwest gates has never been know for their restaurants. They do have a Original New York Seltzer vending machine. ;) Morning flights are always tough food options. CPK has struggled for years with breakfast, as I have tried and tried. Because I travel this terminal often I have seen real changes. They had serious staff issues as limited servers and busboys. Most recently managers and bartenders have stepped up and food waits have decreased. My favorite breakfast time is the Beverly Hills breakfast sandwich with potatoes a good value for the airport. But the bun steals the show!! The bun had been soft and fresh and delicious again and again.  I would not say it otherwise. Hot and good. And the intention on Management to reduce waits was much appreciated.y If your at term 1, breakfast is a safe bet here.

The manager Glen was SO rude to us that if we had been in any other restaurant- not at LAX- we would have walked. Our crime? Asking for garlic to go on a mushroom pizza (with no cheese, as we are vegan).

Am I completely INVISIBLE?  Couldn't get water or menu for 20 min, good, but expensive bloody mary. Decent food, but then waited another 30 min for check. I had to get a busser to ask for my bill. I about had to trip someone for service. Hire more wait staff. There was a photo shoot, but should a client get zero attention? SHITTY service.

Wanted to eat something at the airport that wasn't a burger.  This was one of the few choices available.  It is right near gate 18.  The  food was just ok.. We ordered the bbq chicken pizza for $18.19USD.  It came out looking like a frozen pizza.   Not much sauce, meat or large at all.  Normally, we can't finish an entire pizza.  However, this pizza was sliced into 5 pieces and we were able to all of it.   We also order the shishito peppers.  It was tasty.  However,  a bit on the salty side.   I was fairly disappointed.   I don't think I will come back to this establishment again.

I am going to come to a highly unpopular positive opinion of this CPK- solely because of the efforts of a single employee- Alex. We rolled in a 9 Pm hungry and about to pick up our kiddo. Man was hangry, I was picky. Alex let me taste the soup, offered suggestions and was generally very warm and gracious in demeanor. We ordered food and sat down with our beers. Then checked our phones ... omg the flight was landing way early!! Alex was so sweet- he put our beers in the fridge and kept our food warm and ordered more- 30 minutes we came back when they were closing and they gave us the sweetest service, warm food- we settled up but they gave us no push to go. It was just so genuinely nice. The cheese and pepperoni pizzas were good. Massively overpriced!!! The mushroom pizza was dry and lacked sauce and cheese. I would not reorder. The shrimp were good but probably 2000 calories. Limited beer selection. Prices are obscene. Food was adequate. Alex's service was top notch

It looks tempting, but save your money and spare your body from this place. Service was horribly slow.  Took 20 mins to take my order.  People that were seated after me were already eating while I hadn't ordered. But when the pizza came, it made me sick.  I would have been better off not eating anything at all.  But I got the honor to pay airport prices for this experience.

This was my first time flying out of the LAX airport, and I'd say CPK is one of the top food options since there really aren't many others - especially ones you can just get to-go. Overall I was really impressed!  I got the BBQ salad, and it was very reasonably priced and huge. Really tasty too, although more chicken would have been nice. Considering how busy it was, my food came out right around the time they said it would and it was really fresh.  If I had more time before my flight I would have gone to one of the other places, but if you're in a rush this is a really good option!

I've never had a problem with CPK locations.  All have been good experiences.  I have been to this one twice already -- whenever I have time for a drink before my flight and let's say Rock n' Brews is packed, I'll walk down a little further to CPK.  I noticed on my latest visit that they added a new restaurant a little further down which I am looking forward to checking out next time I'm there.  Its nice to have a variety of options while you're at the airport.   I was seated at the same table I sat at last time I was here, lol.  I ordered a large Angel City IPA and the crispy potatoes.  Even though the potatoes come in a small bowl, I thought it was just right since I had a large beer.  If I were really hungry, I would have possibly ordered the chips and guacamole too.  You're also able to place an order to go up at the front if you would rather eat at your gate or on the plane.  The service here is not bad.

I had the huevos rancheros pizza...I enjoyed it very much.  It had a nice balance of eggs, black beans, scallions and avocado.  Slow to make the pizza, so if your in a hurry this is not the place to get a quick bite!
There aren't a lot of decent food options in this terminal, but if you like CPK, this will do.  Do they ever change the menu?

To-go review. $20 for a personal sized pizza that is slightly burnt and had been sitting in a warming oven. Most expensive pizza ever. However, when you're in a rush at the airport, this will take like the most glorious pizza ever.  Ugh it was painful to buy it. But, it hit the spot when I didn't have time.

This place is garbage. Their pizza is undercooked and overpriced. $20 for a personal pizza is ridiculous. The only reason they get business is because southwest purposely delays their planes causing customers to starve.
CPK does what it does well -- exotic pizza combos, drinks, pastas. This isn't the best CPK in the world, but it's a step above generic airport grub.

Review #040 - 2017 Prior to boarding our 8:55 PM flight on Monday, Feb. 20, we got hungry and decided that CPK would be our best bet. We arrived at about 7:45 and put my name on the list and was seated about 5-7 minutes later.  I know we were cutting it close, but we were being hopeful that our meal would be quick since it is the airport and everyone is more than likely in a hurry so the restaurants would do their best to speed things up, which they did.  Thank goodness! We sat down and I ordered a virgin citrus crusher, which was brought to me pretty quickly. We each ordered a pizza.  Owen and I somehow managed to order the Sicilian, which I told him that he should've ordered something different since he could have half of mine.  Joshua ordered the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza, I think... The food came out about 10-15 minutes later.  My pizza was actually better than I expected, thank goodness Owen ordered his own because Joshua took a slice of mine already.  Joshua seemed to enjoy his pizza as well. My only complaint is that my drink was terrible.  I understand that it's a virgin, but I didn't ask for watered down lemonade w/orange juice.  It was $7 for goodness sakes.  At least, make it drinkable.  I could've asked for a glass of ice water, a few slices of lemon and orange with a few crushed mint leaves and make my own for free.  Sheesh! At least service was good enough and the meal was expedited so I won't complain too much, even though prices at the airport are ridiculously high for everything.

While I debated between ordering a quick $18ish pizza to go, I opted for a Baby Kale Caesar Salad and canned coffee drink. I may be from New Orleans, and we are a bit ig'nant when it comes to the world of kale according to the NY Times but I'm pretty sure two leaves of baby kale and a ton of meh iceberg doesn't constitute calling it a Baby Kale Caesar. The cheese all stuck together as I vigorously shook my salad to cover it with a meh dressing. Yes, it was edible for the most part, but probs gonna pass on this spot for a quick bite in the future.

Nice place with reasonable prices for an airport.  Open air space in the terminal, was a nice contrast to the small stuffy plane.  We had a last minute flight change and had to ask the waitress to pack up our order. She was very nice and accommodating; making sure we had utensils and napkins too.  They serve breakfast as well as a regular menu. This CPK location is not meant for a fast meal, but if you are looking to bide your time, I will keep them in mind next time in LAX and hungry.  Full bar as well.

Ordered the chicken sandwich and it was $17 and it wasn't even real chicken. I don't mind paying $17 for a sandwich at the airport, but the least they could do is give you 100% real chicken for that price. It was basically Subway for $17

Clean.  Service at both the counter for take out and the waitresses for dine in were all friendly, attentive and prompt.  No complaints, except for the price, but that's all airport food, generally.  Probably now the best food option at the Southwest terminal at LAX.

Best place to eat at the southwest terminal!! I travel for work and it's so refreshing to have healthy choices!! They even have organic ketchup on the tables!! Good job CPK!! It's good you keep your quality up at the airport!! So many restaurants think it's ok to service substandard food at the airport!! Yet somehow you guys keep it real!!

Not sure where all the bad reviews come into play. I sat at the bar and had a great experience. I sat down and was instantly asked how I was doing and what I would like to drink. After that is was consistently asked if I was ok, did I need another drink, was I hungry, etc. No complaints here. Good time. I'll be back next time I'm in this terminal.

Really disgusting someone put their cat carrier with cat on the food counter so she could run her credit card,  and food service did not respond or care, also did not wipe it down after the fact so everyone's food now gets to share that surface. I left, not sanaterry, health department?????
Was able to eat a nice lunch here while waiting for other friends to arrive. I had the pizza that came with pepperoni, sausage, and mushrooms (I think!). Service was good.

Went to LAX and I decided to go to California pizza kitchen and I ordered a sandwich a water and a soup for 23 bucks. Really cool when I got the soup in a cup from a gas station that wasn't even halfway full. last time I go to this place. should have gone to a vending machine for dinner. At least then I wouldn't have gotten screwed that bad.

This terminal of the airport is definitely missing food choices... however California pizza kitchen will do the trick before a flight to have something stable in you!  The guy working was super friendly and the pizza was warm, although it was just sitting under a hot lamp it didn't taste that way.
Rude staff. I ordered and wanted to sit and wait and they kept moving me to different places. Because everywhere is reserved for dining even though there aren't many people there.

This is a major upgrade over the rock n roll restaurant..... but the line is extra longggggg and it takes forever for you to get through it.  But the coffee and breakfast sandwiches are decent indeed.  Expensive airport food. Coffee is $3 and the breakfast sandwich is $14.

I've been to other CPKs, and maybe that's why I'm more critical.  The coffee tasted like bad instant coffee. They have no non-dairy milk - it's the 21st century.  I asked for vegan choices and they recommended the Tortilla soup.  It is loaded with cream. The spinach quinoa salad was bland and not worth the $17. The service was nice, but didn't make up for the poor food. I think it has great potential, and crave fresh food, even at airports.  I am hopeful it will improve and would give it another chance.
Best spot to eat in SouthWest. They were premade, however still fresh and hot--just preboxed. I wish I ordered a sandwich or another pizza to go for the airplane ride.

I wish I could give 0 stars. I feel bad for our server Vanessa, she was very sweet and super nice. Desiree, the manager with the worst weave, was super rude and huffy, after complaining to her about how our table was  never cleaned after being there for 3 hours and the spaghetti being hard, she threatened to call the airport police and have me arrested. She was super demeaning and  made me feel like I was intruding in her restaurant. She claimed she was going to comp the food but when fronted with the bill she threw a fit. Do not come here.
Bad service. It is in the airport and they don't know how to serve for carry out except a few limited items. Just a very poor excuse for wasting valuable airport space.
The service was great but I find this place to be over priced. Even though I got a veggie pizza, there was nothing special about the taste at all. I don't think I'll come back here for pizza.

I never liked CPK but hey, I was hungry. Yep, not a good idea. All of the other CPK I been to had terrible service and moderately terrible pizza for the price they charge. Papa John's pizza is better and cheaper. WTF. I don't think the airport location is an excuse so I will just say they suck. Avoid the train wreck. If you really want CPK, you can find their frozen pizza in the freezer at the grocery store and avoid the wait, the bad service, and the bad pizza. Oh wait, you just bought a frozen pizza.

Waited in line for 30 minutes only to be told I can not get an eggs and cheese sandwich listed on the menu. They only had the meat option in which I was told I could scrap off the meat???  The guy was literally making the sandwiches and the meat was separate. So frustrating. Don't have something on the menu if you don't have it. Ridiculous.
They refused to take he slice of cheese off the pre made sandwich prior to throwing it in the microwave... Ok, I'll go somewhere else to spend my money.

Stick with the CPK pizzas if you choose to eat here. The breakfast burrito is not up to the chain's standards. Very soggy, the tortilla fell apart in our hands and it's filled with pizza style Italian sausage so it just doesn't work.
Had the worst cold breakfast burrito I've ever had. Still have an upset stomach. Do not go here.
I'm writing this review just to get the average stars down to one! Yes that's how bad this place is, it actually makes me angry. Worst fake gross breakfast sandwhich I've ever had for $10.

Sorry to say, this is about as good as it gets in the LAX Delta terminal.  Boxed salads, hardly-crafted CPK pizzas.  Meh.  The best thing I can say is they have bottled water to replace the one TSA took from you a few minutes ago...

I had to get breakfast somewhere in the terminal and, since there isn't an amazing selection here, at least it's something.  Finding something gluten-free, vegetarian and hot can be a bit of a challenge in a total fast food chain environment. So, after browsing various menus, I settled on CPK and their Tortilla soup. CPK is generally consistent if nothing else. The soup was good and the service quick. The guy baking the pizzas also waited on me. He was cheerful and got my food to me rapidly. The only thing I can really grumble about is my delayed flight.  I can't really downgrade it for the food because CPK is what CPK is. I would prefer super, uber healthy options but I gotta go with what I have.

Unfortunately this place is sort of your best bet in the Delta LAX Terminal if you don't like McDonalds or don't have time for a sit-down dinner which is ALWAYS my predicament. It is a shame to call this place a CPK because the quality of the food is really nowhere close to the type of food you get at a regular CPK restaurant. Like other reviewers, I would relate this place's pizza similar to frozen pizza. All pizzas are pre-made, they have no honey-wheat crust, and yet the prices are CPK prices. The reason the lines are always so long is because people see the CPK name and get excited. Nothing to be excited about here, it's just better than the other food in the terminal, which isn't saying much.

Hey wait a second, I thought California Pizza Kitchen was supposed to be made "fresh"?      Oh, sorry, this is at the damn airport....    Oh, excuse me, this is an "Express".   What the "Express" means in this case is that the pizza is not made fresh to order, it's available by the slice on some steam tables where you can already plainly see that the "not" real cheese is starting to get the texture of rubber.    Too expensive, no where to sit and a disgrace to "California" pizza.   But what do they care?   No repeat business needed as everyone eating here is leaving the US.     I have not eaten at a California Pizza Kitchen since coming back to the US so there!   HUH!     I remember!    :)

Ordered a BBQ chicken salad from terminal one (SW and Usair terminal) California Pizza kitchen. It was sort of wilted when I opened it but I was hungry, I should have knowN better as I got very sick and had diarrhea for two days. Avoid this place at all costs.
California Pizza Kitchen in California is just about the same as it is in Chicago. There was definitely a lot more diversity amongst the crowd in this one though!

Stop #6 on my Tour of Hell-AX Duty and what I can tell you is this: The people working here are smert!  Newp, that's not a typo, thems are some smert people workin here! Before I hooked up to the internet via the wireless T-Mobile option, I was trying to find out if there was free wifi anywhere in the airport, so I figured I would ask someone that works at the airport I am inquiring about. I assumed this sounded like a reasonable question, but "ass" out of "u" and "me" came into play when the girl working here replies with... "We don't sell internet computers here" *...* Somebody please shoot me. Please.
Not very good pizza for CPK and overpriced as you'd expect with airport food.  You're probably better off going to McDonalds to get some food if you must.

The other reviews are rather negative, but I ordered a Thai Chicken pizza ($10) to split with a friend and found it to be a perfectly satisfying pizza with a little crunch and thickness to the crust, hot melting cheese, and a mess of bean sprouts and flavorful chicken on top.

CPK, the McDonald's of "gourmet" pizza.  I usually don't mind their Thai chicken pizza minus the scallions sprinkled on top.  Apparently though since these are pre-made, the effort to remove said onions is too monumental a task for this crew.  Instead we had a sausage and mushroom one that tasted undercooked.  I officially put a curse on this establishment.  May your fancy undercooked personal pizzas burn in the pits of hades.

To the lady at the bar- you're sassy! And not in a good way- if my only choice is to sit at the bar because there are no available seats elsewhere and the hostess tells me I can sit at the bar. I'm going to sit at the bar even if I don't feel like a drink.  I sat down and she asked what I wanted to drink and I told her ice water- the vibe was obvious that she was annoyed. Sorry, don't feel like drinking , just hungry. I'd be at home eating somewhere else or at a normal CPK with normal prices if my flight didn't get delayed two hours. But, it is what it is. Don't throw the straw at me as you put my water down. I was so turned off that I told her I'd like my pizza togo. She told a guest next to me to move his bag cus there are plenty of people wanting to sit which is fine, if it didn't sound like she was scolding him. This is true however, it's obvious your trying to turn and burn your seats so you get quantity instead of quality tips. So within that hour of you pushing guests out, giving checks to some that weren't ready to check out, and pretty much flat out ignored me until you saw me staring at you and then my pizza that was getting cold in the window- you probably made 30 bucks? But I bet if you'd smile and slow down a second - not making it obvious that customers that don't drink or don't order enough are a nuisance to you - you could've made more. I'm a good tipper and when I say this, I say it proudly cus I've done the service industry before- I know how customers can be and blah blah. Regardless, your service mam, sucked so bad that I literally asked for my pizza Togo and the check 3 min into sitting down.  So thanks for the crap service for my $25 cold pizza. Really appreciate it! Cheers!!

Disappointing. Many tables were dirty and needed to be bussed. I stood at the host stand waiting to be seated for 5 mins as two employees walked by and didn't offer to seat me. They lost my business for tonight's dinner.
Terrible terrible terrible, slow, no selection of on the go items, and TERRIBLE coffee- get an americano.  Line at coffee was too long but wish I'd waited.

I ordered a chicken salad togo from the kitchen and there was literally 1 tiny not much bigger than chicken nugget size piece of chicken on my $16 salad.  What makes matters worse is when I brought it up to the attention of the host he assured me that it was the correct amount... um ok...   well next time I want to feel ripped off right to my face... I will come back.

10 inch pizza is $18 to $19.75 depending which one you get, not worth half that. 4 Adults breakfast with an ice tea a coke and 2 waters was $81. My advice, Stop by Little Caesar on your way to the airport and get just as good of a meal for less than $20. Total ripoff.
Wow is this place poorly managed. 20 min in line for the opportunity to choose from a selection of 1 type of breakfast sandwich and a $4 bottle of water. At least the sandwich was cold...argh.

Food is average but the service here is great. It's in an airport so you don't expect the best but we had great service and the manager even checked in on us. The location is a little crazy but they got us in and out fast with a smile on their faces.

We sat down 45 minutes before our flight boarded today at 5pm and orders 2 appetizers and 2 meals to go. We only got 1 of the appetizers, my burger was wrong and even though I declined the side it arrived with it and our pasta with shrimp was missing the shrimp when it showed up. There is a lack of attention to detail here and in a restaurant at the airport, passengers value speed and quality service, both of which do not exist here. A new manager is needed!

Very poor food quality. Unbelievably horrible service, probably the worst I've had in California. Prices, really? Really? Go get yourself a sandwich somewhere else and save yourselves 40 bucks. Not worth your money or your time.

At the airport and as always, in a hurry. There was a 10 minute wait so we (4) looked at the menu and decided. The waitress showed up quick and we told her that we were on a time limit and ready to order. Out of dumplings so she took the other orders then his last. We ordered mostly salads and Water. All fine. The plates were a good size.  The Kung Pow Chichen noodles were a bit spicy but the kid likes it that way. Our waitress kept the water full. She was quick and efficient from order to payment. We made it to the gate pretty stress free on time.  She had brought a couple plastic boxes for the slower 2 eaters so they could finish on the plane.  A filling meal.

They sell salads mislabeled "Baby Kale Cesar Salad" and the whole salad is made out of Romain. When I showed them that there was ZERO(0) baby Kake, they looked at me and tried to look for Kale unsuccessfully. They didn't offer me a refund or apologized. Their customer service was awful.
Way better than Rock n Brew. Service was good and the pizza was decent. Got the Sicilian and the Pep/saugage/mush. Both were good but Sicilian was better. Might order another one before my flight.

The only reason this place even has 1 star is because I love their food. They are located at in airport, and made us wait for everyone who was eating breakfast to finish up before they could even proceed to seat for lunch. (And their was about 7 tables opened) THEY ARE DOING THIS AT AN AIRPORT. If I ever fly into Cali again, I will not come back here.

I came here out of desperation at LAX and was inclined to write a yelp only because it is literally the filthiest dining establishment I've ever been to in my life. Think menus with dried food or boogers on it, chunks of food all over the floor and our table, etc etc. Get a janitor!
Eric, quite possibly the worst server I've ever encountered and extremely unhelpful putting responsibilities on overworked coworkers.
Ordered a Margherita pizza at 2:45 pm - it arrived at 4:00 pm. Pizza was stone cold and the thin crust was rubbery as if had been microwaved hours earlier. Horrible!! Never order from them again.

I really don't understand why there are so any bad reviews for this place and many other CPK's. So here goes... It's located in an airport food court inbetween Starbucks & La Brea Bakery.  The food court can get a little crowded & the tables are not always bussed as soon as they could be.  I ordered a Thai chicken pizza, and waited about 10 minutes for it. Came out perfect! Fresh veggies! Especially the bean sprouts. If you are a beans proud eater (esp w pho or lumpia) you know what good and bad bean sprouts look like. These sprouts were super fresh & not wilted/brown on the edges. Service was friendly! The little lady screaming the #'s out is better than the announcers at In-N-Out on a busy day.

I don't think of California pizza kitchen as the greatest restaurant, but the breakfast I had at LAX terminal A was fantastic.  I had the CPK omelette.  It had spinach, tomatoes, cheeze, and the best bacon I have had.  The potatoes were pan fried and absolutely to die for.  Service was great.  Only issue was no decaf coffee.  I would recommend this for breakfast anytime.

What a waste of money and time this place is. I was charged $17 for their "ultimate" Bloody Mary, which is a watered down airplane quality drink topped by a tiny cube of dried out cheese. Nasty! The breakfast sandwich was limp and soggy and tasteless. I don't have high expectations for airport food but this was BAD!

Been here several times because there aren't many food options in terminal 1. Consistently awful. It's a surprise each time what they screw up, but I guarantee that the food and service will be a disaster.

You're in the airport (Southwest terminal) you have some time to kill before your flight and you're hungry.  You see CPK and figure, why not?  That was the predicament I was in and regret that "cheese" pizza.  It's expensive, doesn't taste like real cheese, and just makes you feel guilty afterwards.  I've had better frozen pizzas than this.  So, instead, when you're in that moment of desperation at LAX, just opt for a small treat from Starbucks nextdoor or perhaps something from Gordon Biersch across the way - definitely pass on CPK!
